Even the minor details on the Vado SL let you know you're on a luxury bike. The kick stand, for instance, is perfectly situated close to the back of the bike, and (hallelujah!) it doesn't rattle when you go over bumps. The Shimano gears, while not quite the top-of-the-line model that I had navely been expecting on a $7000 bike, are crisp and accurate, and when you're coasting they click loud enough that other cyclists will know you're on an expensive bike.
